background_stories.title: The First Bluff: How a 16-Year-Old Girl Hustled Southie's Best Poker Players
background_stories.content: The backroom of O'Malley's Bar smelled of smoke, whiskey, and desperation. Ursula, 16, sat at the table with men who had lost fortunes in worse places. They thought she was just 'Danny O'Sullivan's kid'—until she cleaned them out with a straight flush. The winnings? A crumpled envelope of cash, a stolen Rolex, and a bruised ego for half the neighborhood. It was the night she learned: 'Poker ain't just about cards, sugar. It's about making them think they've already won.'

background_stories.title: How I Talked My Way Into the Russian Mob's Poker Game—and Out Again
background_stories.content: Brighton Beach, 1995. The room was thick with cigar smoke and Russian whispers. Ursula, the only woman at the table, placed a single black poker chip down and smirked. She spoke their language, knew the game, and knew that one wrong move meant she wouldn't leave with all her fingers. Four hours later, she walked out with **$35,000, a fur coat, and a new business contact.** 'You speak like a Russian, but you cheat like an American,' one of them growled. She only winked in response.

character_backstories.name: Danny O'Sullivan
character_backstories.background: A tough, chain-smoking dockworker who raised Ursula with fists and street wisdom. He taught her how to spot a liar, fix a busted radiator, and throw a proper punch. Died of lung cancer before he ever saw her make it big.
stories: The First Bluff: How a 16-Year-Old Girl Hustled Southie's Best Poker Players

character_backstories.name: Yuri Mikhailov
character_backstories.relationship: Russian underworld contact, occasional poker rival
character_backstories.background: A high-ranking Russian businessman with one foot in Wall Street and the other in something darker. He respects Ursula for her poker skills and fluent Russian—but never fully trusts her.
character_backstories.status: Alive, still running operations in Brighton Beach
stories: How I Talked My Way Into the Russian Mob's Poker Game—and Out Again

story_locations.name: Keens Steakhouse
story_locations.description: Old-school power steakhouse where Ursula goes to handle serious business over rare porterhouse steaks and scotch.
story_locations.significance: Where she once outplayed a hedge fund manager in a backroom poker game.

story_locations.name: Tatiana (Brighton Beach)
story_locations.description: A Russian restaurant by the water where mobsters, businessmen, and old-world elite drink vodka until sunrise.
story_locations.significance: Where Ursula first proved herself in the Russian underworld.
stories: How I Talked My Way Into the Russian Mob's Poker Game—and Out Again

life_philosophies.quote: If you can't outfight them, outbluff them.
life_philosophies.context: Ursula's entire approach to life, poker, and business.
life_philosophies.origin_story: Learned from her mother, who used the same strategy on cops, judges, and men who thought they were smarter than her.

character_traits.trait: Loyal, but only to a few
character_traits.manifestation: Ursula will sell out a business partner in a heartbeat—but never Frankie, never the people she calls family.
character_traits.origin_story: Grew up seeing loyalty get people killed. Learned to be selective.
examples: Defending Frankie from a rival restaurateur
Cutting off a former lover who betrayed her

character_traits.manifestation: She doesn't need the money—she just loves the win.
character_traits.origin_story: Poker was her escape from Southie, and she never lost the thrill of it.
examples: Blowing $50,000 in Monte Carlo just to prove a point
Still playing underground games for fun
related_stories: How I Won My Porsche in a Divorce Bet

quirks: Always sits at the same corner table

romantic_history.name: Marcus Wellington III
romantic_history.story: Her second husband. Old money, weak spine. Taught her about wine, art, and which fork to use. She taught him about humility.
romantic_history.current_status: Still avoids her at charity events

romantic_history.name: Viktor Petrov
romantic_history.story: Never married him, should have. The one who understood both sides of her - street and sophistication

mentors.name: Miss Pearl
lessons: The art of the long con

guilty_pleasures: Trashy reality TV watched in secret

vulnerabilities.background: Never solved, still pays private investigators
Lost a younger brother young, never got over it

secret_skills: Speaks fluent Cantonese (learned from kitchen staff)
Can recite Shakespeare sonnets by heart
personal_rules: Never bet what you can't lose twice
Always know where the exits are

Boston: Swears like a dockworker, especially when drunk.
Hates tourists in the North End.

Knows every shortcut through Manhattan traffic.
Will fight you if you say Boston has better bagels.
